title: Business & Finance
text:
Microsoft posted its worst quarterly earnings decline in more than two years and the weakest revenue growth in more than five years, and said that it expects further sluggishness.

---

Adidas said it would end its partnership with Kanye West and Gap said it would pull apparel he helped design, after a string of controversies including a recent anti-Semitic outburst from the musician.

---

Major U.S. stock indexes extended a rally, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials gaining 1.6%, 2.3% and 1.1%, respectively.

---

Americans are renting fewer apartments as demand in the third quarter fell to its lowest level in 13 years, after a long stretch of record-high rents.

---

GE said quarterly profit fell and outlined plans to cut costs in its renewable-energy business, where troubles offset strong gains in the company's aerospace division.

---

GM said it is reducing its target for EV sales because of a delay in ramping up battery output, as the company issued an upbeat third-quarter earnings report.

---

Intel's Mobileye unit priced its IPO at $21 a share, a dollar above the top of its targeted range, according to people close to the deal.
